channel.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Explisionist, post:27, topic:424918”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=527580.msg3846067#msg3846067 date=1323633081]

That’s saying if you have like a knife, and you use it on a log it makes a bow, etc… Basically that’s calling the process, then you would just have the names of the items in other cases.

thats what I mean the process calling is what I don’t get,
readunsignedword why isn’t it called int usedWithSlot = CallUsedWithProcess.

know what I mean
theres like a bunch of such complicated lines
I’m not english and it’s hard to make the connection,

That’s just the way it was set up, you can change it but you have to change all of it… It’s just like why do we use a bunch of booleans calling things like premiumItems, etc… Normally they use something to go with multiple items instead of just using a word that will set it to one item.

yeah, well keep coding and I will get it one day I guess
[/quote]
Its always weird ways to read it, like a bunch of servers have a bunch of cases that do nothing and just make it look good.[/quote]
yeah ik but the questions is where they are
I would love to upgrade delta, so there’s finally a descent base
but will be for in a few years ><

Read full topic

theres like a bunch of such complicated lines

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I mean like this:

case 53:
			// Use item on item
			int usedWithSlot = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			int itemUsedSlot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
			// int useWith = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndianA();
			int interface1284 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			// int itemUsed = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
			int interfacek = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			// usedWithSlot += 1;
			// itemUsedSlot += 1;
			int useWith = playerItems[usedWithSlot] - 1;
			int itemUsed = playerItems[itemUsedSlot] - 1;
			Crafting.itemOnItem(this, itemUsed, useWith);
			Herblore.itemOnItem(this, itemUsed, useWith);
			TutItem.itemOnItem(this, itemUsed, useWith);
			if (!playerHasItem(itemUsed) || !playerHasItem(useWith)) {
				break;
			}
			int otherItem = playerItems[usedWithSlot] - 1;
			// println("itemUsed=" + itemUsed + ", usedWithSlot=" + usedWithSlot
			// + ", otherItem=" + otherItem);

like inStream.readUnsignedWord();
wtf is this

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:20, topic:424918”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=527580.msg3846036#msg3846036 date=1323631383]

voila my delta skills won lol

Im only coding for like 5 months, and changing home and npc spanwing and thinking that u made a cool server with doing that, is included in these 5 months lol.
I’m still learning, I would love to start hyperion but my knowledge is just not advanced enough yet

It’s pretty easy once you learn how, it just takes some time, I started with devolution and I still love going back to it and messing around with it, I just hated when Delta came out because everyone was using it as a base and not changing crap.

That’s the hard part,
It’s full of tutorial for simple things, but the shit that mathers like improving the base, there are barely out of rsps view and the ones that are there are mostly not noobfriendly,
it’s hard to learn it on your own.

What I do is generally improving the gaming experience,
packaging
adding skillclasses with the actually full skills.
Added beginner tutorial in my teamproject (i just posted a vid of it)

but the real coding is hard

I started out with just messing around with changing stuff. I then found out how to create a bunch of things… Like in one of my first bases I added firemaking, making potions, etc… And all I did was make it where if you use item on item delete both and add the one its suppose to make along with exp… Then I started to do harder things, and I finally got to where I could understand it when I look at it.
[/quote]
I know what you mean,
I’m over that part already
but it’s generally changing things,

I mean like
if item on item deleted item add item addxp
it so easy

but the methods itself to make the itemonitem work looks so complicated and is connected to other classes ect, its so fucking hard to find out how that works[/quote]
Just look around in your files and see if it was made before i did that til I learned how to do it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @Nookumdip Nookumdip
item.description:
@Nookumdip wrote:

Ok guys thanks for your help o.o.

And this is what i used:

    case 0:
    if(q1 == 0) {
    sM("You search the crate...");
    sM("And find a whip and some coins!");
    addItem(4151, 1);
    addItem(995, 1000000);
    setAnimation (881);
    q1 = 1;

And then I added
} else
sM(“You have already recieved this prize!”);
break;

And it works fine
Thanks you

Read full topic

I like to work with delta and I fucking hate PI
everyone his own preferences, deal with that.

Though I would directly move to hyperion if I had the knowledge ><[/quote]

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:9, topic:424918”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=527580.msg3845975#msg3845975 date=1323628557]

I think you can do something like

if c.hasClicked
tele, (coord, coord)

No. Just no.

public boolean hasReceived = false;

      case 0:
      if (!hasReceived) {
      sM("You search the crate...");
      sM("And find a whip and some coins!");
      addItem(4151, 1);
      addItem(995, 1000000);
      setAnimation (881);
     } else {
      sM("You have already revived this prize!");
      break;

Not complete, but work with it.

EDIT: RandQm, why are you using an integer?? Use a boolean.

Because Delta is basically made up of integer’s.
[/quote]
Thats fucking retarded…[/quote]
go appolo if u wanna act pro

Read full topic

Because Delta is basically made up of integer’s.
[/quote]
Thats fucking retarded…[/quote]
That’s what I said, when it was made devolution was easier to use, and read… Delta made it where you have to call every little thing, instead of calling it once for each case.

item.source: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta

item.title: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

tyb97:

add a boolean.

I don’t think u helped him with that, if he knew how he wouldn’t be asking help.

So delta, k look in your character files u should see some lines like this:
q1 = 0
q2 = 0

If no say so if yes do this for your command:

case 0: 
      if(q1 == 0) {
      sM("You search the crate...");
      sM("And find a whip and some coins!");
      addItem(4151, 1);
      addItem(995, 1000000);
      setAnimation (881);
      q1 = 1;
}
      break;

So when the player did the command q1 is set to 1 and the command can not be done anymore since u have to have 0 to do it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a command you can only use once ? Delta
